intro: Echinomastus centralis, commonly known as the central echinomastus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Echinomastus centralis is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
